ygData.subject: RE: appearance, charm song
ygData.msgSnippet: Not invisible.  it looks like a blackened version of a standard Banded helm. ... RE: [eqbards] appearance, charm song Sounds like the
ygData.messageBody:
Not invisible. it looks like a "blackened" version of a standard Banded
helm.



At 05:49 PM 8/19/99 -0400, you wrote:

>>>>

<excerpt>RE: [eqbards] appearance, charm song


<bigger>Sounds like the Blackened Iron Crown should work for you. Its
AC5 invisible I believe, and ads 5 to STR and 5 to all resistances, found
in RunnyEye I hope to get one myself someday.</bigger>


<bigger>Kitasi</bigger>


<bigger>-----Original Message-----</bigger>

<bigger>From: rkroads@...
[<<mailto:rkroads@...>mailto:rkroads@...]</bigger>

<bigger>Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 3:36 PM</bigger>

<bigger>To: eqbards@onelist.com</bigger>

<bigger>Subject: [eqbards] appearance, charm song</bigger>


<bigger>From: rkroads@...</bigger>


<bigger>Regarding appearance:</bigger>

<bigger>As a bard I am interested in my appearance to my audience. Of
course</bigger>

<bigger>protecting my hide is also important! I am searching for
effective</bigger>

<bigger>armor which is either invisible or attractive (not a tin pot on
the</bigger>

<bigger>head) for a female half-elf.</bigger>


<bigger>Regarding Solon's Song of the Sirens (Level 27):</bigger>

<bigger>Which commands do others use with the charm song? I have
concentrated</bigger>

<bigger>on /pet attack and /pet guard me. I am committed to practicing
this</bigger>

<bigger>technique as I was impressed with John Kim's description of its
power. </bigger>

<bigger>I am improving while using in Cazic-Thule but it is difficult to
use! </bigger>

<bigger>Please share your tips and suggestions.</bigger>


<bigger>--------------------------- ONElist Sponsor
----------------------------</bigger>


<bigger>ONElist: your connection to online communities.</bigger>


<bigger>------------------------------------------------------------------------</bigger>

</excerpt>




Steven S. Klug

-- sklug@...
